text: Monika Kørra (born September 5, 1989) is an author and former athlete from Norway. ==Biography== ===Athletics=== In 2008, she won the bronze medal in the 3000 metre steeplechase at the Norwegian championships representing the Norwegian club Friidrettsklubben Ren-Eng. She also competed in the 2008 World Junior Championships in Athletics – Women's 3000 metres steeplechase at the 2008 World Junior Championships in Athletics, finishing twelfth in her heat and failing to reach the final. Kørra won a sports scholarship at Southern Methodist University in Dallas, Texas. ===Authorship=== On December 5, 2009, she was kidnapped, assaulted and raped by three men living illegally in the United States.Dallas Morning News: "SMU student turns rape into message of survival" April 2011Good Housekeeping Magazine: "My Good Deed Turned Into My Worst Nightmare" By Monika Kørra December 23, 2015 Arturo Arevalo and Alfonso Zuniga received life sentences while the third, Luis Zuniga, received 25 years.CBS DFW:"3rd Man Sentenced In SMU Student’s Rape" April 29, 2011 Instead of staying silent about her ordeal, she chose to come forward with her story and in 2015, she completed a book in English entitled Kill the Silence stating that "It's not what happens to you, but how you respond to it that matters." In her book, she details how she forgave her perpetrators telling them "I don't hate them; I hate what they did to me. Two of them even cried...That really meant a lot to me because then I saw that it is something good in everyone."ESPN: "Monika Korra breaks the silence" by Kory Kozak April 15, 2012 She went on to graduate from Southern Methodist University.Dallas Obsrver: "Monika Korra: The Survivor" By Anna Merlan June 23, 2012 In 2012, she founded the Monika Kørra Foundation dedicated to creating awareness of the prevalence and effects of sexual assault and to provide a place of healing for victims.Premiere Speaker's Bureau: "Monika Korra" retrieved February 20, 2017 She has appeared in the media in both the United States and Norway including as a guest on the TV talk show Skavlan on October 9, 2015.nettavisen.no: Gjengvoldtatt av tre menn - nå har hun tilgitt dem, hentet 10. oktober 2015 In 2009, Kørra was awarded the SMU Athletics' Perseverance Award for her courage. In 2012, she received the Wilma Rudolph Student Athlete Achievement Award. ===Book=== * Kill the Silence ==Awards== * Wilma Rudolph Student Athlete Achievement Award ==References== ==Other websites== * Biography * Monika Kørra Foundation * Kill the Silence * Wilma Rudolph Achievement Award Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Norwegian writers Category:Norwegian athletes
